meanings.definition: The quality or state of being permeable.
meanings.sent1: The permeabilities of the soil allowed water to seep through easily.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the permeabilities of different materials to understand their ability to let substances pass through.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's suit had special permeabilities that made it impossible for any liquid to stain it.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a permeability that touched everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The permeabilities of the membrane were so high that nothing could be contained within.

meanings.definition: The ability to allow liquids or gases to pass through.
meanings.sent1: The permeabilities of the fabric made it breathable and comfortable to wear.
meanings.sent2: Engineers tested the permeabilities of the material to ensure proper ventilation in the building.
meanings.sent3: The chef's recipe had the perfect permeabilities to let the flavors blend harmoniously.
meanings.sent4: His words had a permeability that cut through the silence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The permeabilities of the filter were crucial in purifying the water for drinking.
